website_summaries.verdict: Designed specifically to teach 5-12 year olds about insects.
pros: Built-in night-vision light, magnifier, and belt clip turns bug catching into a kid-friendly adventure
Parents rave that the "toy" gently sucks insects into a viewing chamber
Creatures can then be released outdoors
Holes are small enough to suck up ants
cons: Toy works best with fresh AA batteries

customer_reviews.title: Would be perfect if it lasted!
customer_reviews.text: This was a really cool product and my little boy loved it when he got it for Christmas. Unfortunately it only lasted a few days until it stopped sucking up bugs and no longer worked. The light will still come on and it seems to be trying to work but it doesn't. I've even replaced the batteries but it still doesn't work . Totally bummed out since the construction of it is actually pretty smart with a magnifying glass that flips over to let bugs in and out and let you get an up close view of the bug inside.
customer_reviews.author: Mom2aprincess

customer_reviews.title: It Does Suck Up Bugs
customer_reviews.text: The motor suction power seemed to be a little more powerful than the backyard safari brand of bug vacuum. I purchased the bug vacuum to fight an invasion of Japanese beetles. For being a kids toy, it is successful about 70% of the time for capturing the beetles off my plants. It hasn't worked well for flies. I imagine that it would work for a spider. As for kids toy entertainment, my son thinks it is fun to use. If you are concerned about the well being of a bug or insect, injury could happen to the bug or insect. A few beetles lost legs.
customer_reviews.author: A. S.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: So im an adult lol this is not just for kids! We moved into a house with TONS of cellar spiders and I dont have the heart to kill them. So I wanted something to safely yeet them into my back yard. It works! But it's probably made for small bugs since I had to unscrew the extension on it so these big AF spiders would get sucked in. Otherwise no complaints here! Even comes with a magnify glass so you can see just how horrific these creatures are that live in your house. Lesson learned - dont stand UNDERNEATH whatever you're trying to vacuum because if you miss, guess where they're landing.
customer_reviews.author: Rnw.7

customer_reviews.title: Great toy to catch stinkbugs with!!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this fun toy if you live in Maryland or the surrounding area, especially if you live in an older home, because of our beloved friend in these parts...the stinkbug!! Right out the box, out it to use and caught about 2 dozen of the buggers! Makes it easier to catch, less chance of squishing and making a real mess! Just wish the vacuum was stronger, the stink bugs have a good grip on whatever they are holding on to.
customer_reviews.author: Michael James Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Suck enough
customer_reviews.text: The concept of this is perfect, when coupled with the compatible bug zoo, you can suck and then capture bugs with no chance of mistake. The problem is, the sucking power is barely enough for a tiny moth. I tried a common housefly and with or without the nozzle, an inch or two (or closer) away wasn't enough to capture them. I'm about to re-wire the thing for more power and see if that helps. Don't expect this to suck, it sucks!
customer_reviews.author: andy cooper

customer_reviews.title: it works fine to suck up hitchhikers in our RV
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what some people are expecting with this thing. It's a toy. It's meant to be a toy. It's not a DustBuster... Anyway, it works fine to suck up hitchhikers in our RV. Works best on larger insects like beetles and moths. Harder to grab ants and "no-see-ems". Replaced the original batteries and it worked better. Worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: ruslruslrusl

customer_reviews.title: Not what we expected!
customer_reviews.text: The suction was not strong enough to catch a fly. My kids were sooooo excited to get this as a gift, but they were disappointed that it had low suction power AND BROKE WITHIN 24 hours. They probably played with it for half hour in our small backyard. This is my honest review to help others, so please vote “helpful” if this helped you in any way! Thank you and God bless you!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Yoon

customer_reviews.title: POOR BUILD QUALITY. BROKE IN 2 DAYS
customer_reviews.text: The magnifiyng glass that spins inside broke litterally the first time I spun it. My son really wanted it so I decided to keep it. Second day he had it, it stopped working. I had to open it using a screwdriver and found the switch on the trigger bent back. It was pretty delicate so I tried my best to unbend it but it was already cracked. The trigger felt funny since the beginning. It rained both days so my son didnt even get to use in on insects. Smh. Poor build quality for something young kids will be using outdoors. Either we received a bad unit or its POOR BUILD QUALITY. Check out Ebay instead.
customer_reviews.author: H. Saucedo

customer_reviews.title: Greatest bug catcher ever
customer_reviews.text: Greatest bug catcher ever. Vaccums up bugs without hurting them. Easily comes apart so that you can view the bug through the middle portion of the gun where the bug is captured. Magnifiying glass on the middle section to view the bugs is creative and useful. My daughter spent an hour running around the house looking for bugs, inside and outside. She had a great time in the evening, catching all the tiny bugs flocking to the light on our porch!
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Success!
customer_reviews.text: My grandkids had SO MUCH FUN playing with the bug vacuum! It's such a crazy toy but the kids ages 6 to 12 had fun with it and they worked as a team; one would find the bugs, the second would use the bug vacuum and the third would transfer the bugs into container - then they shifted so each one of them could do each step. I didn't expect the bug vacuum to last but it has! Even the little light has kept on shining. This was definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Murison

customer_reviews.title: Not much suction and meant for tiny bugs
customer_reviews.text: Well I bought this to try to suck up all of the stink bugs that have invaded my house. I don't want to squash them because A) I don't want them to stink and B) I don't like killing bugs (except for flies, mosquitos, ticks, fleas and roaches, which I don't have but i would kill them if we did). That said the suction was woefully weak and the hole is meant for tiny bugs like small ants. So fail on the execution of my needs, I sent it back. If I were buying for a kid, I still think it's lame. Nice packaging though.
customer_reviews.author: CT Reader

customer_reviews.title: Not durable.
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this for the one day it worked, both times we ordered it. I ordered and returned one. Then received another and it also broke after two days of use. We changed batteries and everything with no help. Great idea but this is not durable and worth your money sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent for the price and quite efficient, slight flaw
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good honestly. I have severe arachnophobia and needed a way to get the pests away so I won’t be constantly freaking out. However while batteries are included they suck and won’t last long, get some good name brand for power as earlier today it wasn’t strong enough to get a big spider off the wall and I ran to change the batteries to come back to an empty wall and knowing the spider is somewhere in my room. Great if you live alone and can’t handle spiders, the tip is a bit small if you have wider spiders beware, but I think I’m gonna rig it to have a funnel to help catch them better.
customer_reviews.author: Reagan Parker

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 5 min.
customer_reviews.text: Got for my son's birthday, opened it up played with it for 5 min. And now the vacuum does not work but light turns on still and makes noise. Very disappointing, would give no stars if possible
customer_reviews.author: Kmieciak.A

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this to catch little critters to feed his pet spider. After a good bit of uses something has loosened around the fan blades so he can’t use it while pointing it down, otherwise the blades hit the housing. He still makes it work though, just would be nice if he didn’t have that to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: LowWattage

customer_reviews.title: good toy for the kids.
customer_reviews.text: it's very gentle on the sucking part, it won't pull in flies unless you can catch them tired. it will suck in moths and some spiders, so not totally useless. it you attach the sucking chamber (that part is detachable), to the end of a shop vac you can really catch things, but carrying a shop vac around defeats it's portability and will probably kill the specimen.
customer_reviews.author: amzn buyer

customer_reviews.title: Idea great, product not so.
customer_reviews.text: Only lasted 1 day of suction and only used within that day for about an hour total time. And then it stopped working. So we will be returning this product and buy something else. Also the suction wasn't the greatest for crawling bugs but flying bugs (like a bee) will look for a normal kids bug out in this price range. But the idea would have been great! Bought for a Passover gift while teaching the plaques.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the bug lovers
customer_reviews.text: This bug catcher catches small bugs. The suction isn’t super strong where you can just go catch a latch bug. That said, my 4.5 year old loves this thing. It’s durable. Easy to take apart. Easy for him to use too. Battery life is so-so. If you have a child who loves bug hunting then you’ll want to add this to his/her collection!
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic Sweets

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and underpowered, but useful.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to get stray crickets out of my bearded dragon's enclosure after feeding time. It does do the job, but you have to be right on top of the cricket and even then they can easily cling to anything with texture. I'm modifying mine with a lithium ion battery and charge circuit to make it much more powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Bigtrain3751

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for any kid who is interested in bugs. Even though it is a toy, it does a sufficient job doing of sucking up bugs. It does such a great job that my wife uses it to suck up bugs that she finds around the house. I guess she likes that better than catching or smashing them with a paper towel. One the bug is sucked up you can close the window, unscrew the nozzle, and view the bug through the magnifying glass. It allows you to see all the details and get close up to the bug. 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bruck

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson as a gift and he fell in love with it. Being winter there weren't too many bugs so we've been looking forward to spring and just settling for the occasional fruit fly that would make it's way through. But, unfortunately, within less than a month the vacuum quit working. We thought it was the batteries, so we replaced those and the light still comes on but still no vacuum at all. Otherwise, when it did work, it was lots of fun for him. He was so excited and I'm so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not all of them work
customer_reviews.text: This product itself is fun! I bought two and one works great. My 4 year old loves it. The other one didn’t work out of the box, even when we tried new batteries. The frustration is also having to go through the process to return a relatively cheap toy for a refund for something that never worked.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Not really strong enough to catch bugs easily.
customer_reviews.text: Great concept but doesn't work well. Unless you can get right on top of the bug doesn't pick it up. smaller bugs it will pick up can't really see in the magnifier. Had fun with it with grandson but disappointed from expectation. Needs a little stronger suction
customer_reviews.author: dudiesmom

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: My son absolutely LOVES this toy. I have even started ordering them as gifts for kids in his age range of 4/5. It works perfectly! The motor doesnt have crazy suction but it is definitely enough for little bugs like ants. Keeps my kiddo happy for sure!
customer_reviews.author: S. OGrady

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: This was an Easter gift. Today is Tuesday, 2 days later and it's just a show piece. The vacuum portion worked for a half hour before stopping completely. During the 30 minutes the toy was functional, it was not even strong enough to suck an ant up. Replaced batteries several times but appears this toy is a complete dud.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost zero suction!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is made pretty good, but as far as doing what it is supposed to do, it doesn't. The suction is not enough to suck any bug into the nozzle. A bug can be directly in front of it, and it will not pull it in. I was very disappointed with this product. I don't recommend this product at all!
customer_reviews.author: Audiobookman

customer_reviews.title: Suck it will not
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item for my son for a Christmas present, at first worked great. after a few hours of use and fun, the fun ended, the trigger for the vacuum fan to turn on would not work. I would say it is a cheaply made product. I will admit I am not expecting much, yet a little better quality would have been nice. Yes I replaced batteries, the light works, just not the fan. Feel free to contact. thank you
customer_reviews.author: Sharkbees007

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, broke within weeks
customer_reviews.text: Cheap crap. The motor button was nearly impossible to use, then stopped working all together. The funnel doesn't stayed screwed on, and pops right off. Don't waste your money and certainly don't buy on line, where returning is annoying / impossible. Also writing a review for one of their other products, which was equally terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Skippy

customer_reviews.title: Decent little bug catcher for kids.
customer_reviews.text: It is a cute little toy. My almost 4yr old likes it. It isnt the sturdiest thing, Im sure it would break if dropped on the ground hard enough. But my son knows to be careful with it. The suction isnt the best but still decent. All in all, my son likes it, good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Porto

customer_reviews.title: Bugs Suck, as so does this thing, in a very good way!!
customer_reviews.text: If you're not a bug squisher/killer, then this is for you. It sucks them right up, allows you to take a look at your newly acquired beast through a magnifying glass, then let's you cut them loose unharmed outside or on your wife's side of the bed, the choice is all yours. Seriously though, it works great. I wish I would have made this purchase years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Pricey and weak
customer_reviews.text: The kids love it. But it doesn’t have great suction unless you really create a seal. It is nice that you can unscrew the bug compartment and still have the bug in it. It’s just a little pricey for how weak it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jdiddy

customer_reviews.title: I Know It's plastic, but...
customer_reviews.text: We've owned many different brands of these bug catchers, and they do eventually wear down and break... But this one went faster than all the rest. The motors went out after a few times of use (we bought two) and have made these "toys" useless. Buy the cheap drugstore ones instead - they actually preform better longer.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: this item has a factory defect the design is for a skinny long positive tip on the battries
customer_reviews.text: the batteries are cheap but you would expect that. if yours quit working like mine did when you put new batteries in it look at the positive ends on the little flap on the gun. take a knife or something and trim the plastic down until the battery will fit in the slot problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: janneth henderson

customer_reviews.title: My son uses this outside all the time.
customer_reviews.text: One of my sons favorite toys. He loves taking it out in the yard to go bug hunting. He gets very excited when he finds something to place and observe in the inspection chamber. Keep fresh batteries handy because once they fade a little the vacuum loses a lot of its strength.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: You will want a refund.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t last. Worked nicely and my kid loved it. Next day the motor would not go on. The green light worked but not the motor. So we changed the batteries. Same result. Very disappointed. Will I get money back? One thing is for sure. I should have read the reviews. Looks like many people have suffered the same problem. I wish Amazon cared enough about the consumer to protect us from bad products. Such a hassle to get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews! Worked literally 5 minutes then the fan stopped working. I tried replacing the batteries and now the suction power stinks and we couldn’t suck up an ant if we wanted too. It’s too bad, my son loves the thought of this! I wish it would have worked. Going to return. It’s not worth the money paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: ROXANNE

customer_reviews.title: Very low suction for crickets
customer_reviews.text: If it had more suction power it’d be perfect. Using it to round up the crickets my beardie doesn’t eat. You have to be right on top of them to suck them up.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin & DD

customer_reviews.title: How the Grinch/ Bug vacuum stole Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, it just came in a loose amazon box. No box if it’s own. No original box. So tacky. Now my son is opening it for Christmas and the vacuum doesn’t even work. I took the batteries out it came with and replaced them with new ones and still nothing. My son is devastated on Christmas. Do not buy this mess. I give this zero stars. They made me give it one in orders to post! But I don’t mean it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren J.

customer_reviews.title: Suction is weak
customer_reviews.text: I hate crickets, so I bought this to use to get feeder crickets out for my lizard. Air is very weak. Only works if I scoop them up at the same time. New batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: Took it to camp. HOURS AND I MEAN HOURS of fun for my kids! They have some much fun with this and I'm not gonna lie I have borrowed it to suck up that sneaky spider who gets into the house from time to time. Great suction a easy to use. Our 2 year old can use it with ease as well.
customer_reviews.author: NMM

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working within 1 hour
customer_reviews.text: My son was so excited about this because he loves bugs! He used his allowance to buy it and within 1 hour, it stopped sucking. He was so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Us

customer_reviews.title: Great to gift
customer_reviews.text: One of our favorite things to gift to kiddos. We have one and we love it. We find this to be a popular gift for friends with kiddos.
customer_reviews.author: chrissy

customer_reviews.title: He loved it, but it broke on the first day!
customer_reviews.text: This bug vacuum had the potential to be super fun and he really loved it, but the vacuum part stopped working by the end of the first day. He never even got to catch a bug. We changed the battery and still no luck. Unfortunately, we had purchased this quite early for a late November birthday and by the time we figured out it was faulty we had already passed the return window. I'd check out the one from Lakeshore Learning next time instead.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Burnham

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have a safe way to remove a bug from the house. it doesnt hurt or squish them, you can simple take it outside and open it.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: easy to catch them int he morning when they are ...
customer_reviews.text: Would give it 5 stars if it had more suction, it has enough suction, i use it to get the flys out of the house, easy to catch them int he morning when they are still drowsy
customer_reviews.author: Lee Jason Olley

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The trigger broke within the first half hour of giving it to my son. Now it takes all his strength to pull the trigger and make it work.
customer_reviews.author: joel

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after a month
customer_reviews.text: These was the coolest toy until it stopped working exactly 2 days after the return window of a month. 😩 now, I have a sad kid.
customer_reviews.author: Kata3mom

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for the kids
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 of these for the grandkids a couple of months ago, and they loved running around the yard collecting bugs and turning them loose. So far, the motors and all around construction of the catchers is holding up to the kids' not-so-gentle handling of them. Good product, good quality, good times!
customer_reviews.author: Lora Frost

customer_reviews.title: Catches aaalll the mosquitos
customer_reviews.text: This thing is life. Catches aaalll the mosquitos and even the small-medium sized wolf spiders I've been finding in my house lately. Suction is low for a reason, just make sure it has fresh batteries and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaMayFit

customer_reviews.title: The "LIGHT" feature never turns off unless the battery is ...
customer_reviews.text: The "LIGHT" feature never turns off unless the battery is removed. It is inconvenient to reinstall the batteries every time you want to use the toy... But, if you don't remove them, the batteries will run down. Is there a way to fix this or did I get a broken one?
customer_reviews.author: M. Van Eaton

customer_reviews.title: My 5-year old bug-lover is obsessed with this vacuum. ...
customer_reviews.text: My 5-year old bug-lover is obsessed with this vacuum. He catches all kinds of things and studies them through the little magnifying glass. I’ve caught two black widows in it (ewwww). It’s held up for a year so far!!
customer_reviews.author: ZMomUtah

customer_reviews.title: They could do better
customer_reviews.text: Low quality in my opinion suction very low , also bugs are able to be sucked into fan and die , also notot went out very soon
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum stopped working few days after my son used it ...
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum stopped working few days after my son used it, the light turns on so with replaced batteries. Im not sure if there is a way to get a replacement if i'll send it back, will i be charged for shipping?
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Broken on arrival
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for each of my boys... We tried it out before Christmas the one is BROKEN wont vaccum! Even changed the batteries... Now my youngest wont have one in time. :(
customer_reviews.author: Corinne

customer_reviews.title: Poor suction
customer_reviews.text: The vacuum is not powerful enough, it’s complicated to use, it’s hard to catch and keep a bug inside the catcher. My 6yo boy is pretty disappointed, so I would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: ISABELLA

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: Big disappointment! The light works but the gun suction only worked for a few seconds. We changed the batteries but that did not help. I am glad we checked it out before giving it to our Grandson.
customer_reviews.author: Cathey L. Beldin

customer_reviews.title: Random fun - stinkbug vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: Our city has been inundated with stinkbugs the last few years in the wintertime. My 4 yo son asked Santa for this two years in a row after seeing an expensive catalog version. He delights in hunting them down and releasing them back outside. Will be even more fun in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: L. M.

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t order again
customer_reviews.text: Sent item as a gift to my nephews, 1 catcher was missing the vacuum piece and the other the vacuum piece that screws on will not stay tight or on- the the toy doesn’t work Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Ssssstreets

customer_reviews.title: Bugs catcher
customer_reviews.text: Very good catching bugs/insects without killing. My kids loved it! They bring it everywhere and never ask any help any more!
customer_reviews.author: ismail demirors

customer_reviews.title: Only worked once...
customer_reviews.text: My ex-wife had one of these years ago and it worked fine. I have a house that attracts spiders and other bugs and this toy would allow us to vacuum up a bug and then put it outside. So I bought this one and it only worked once, then stopped having enough suction. Maybe there’s a setting somewhere but I cannot find it.
customer_reviews.author: Severin Browne

customer_reviews.title: Not too functional
customer_reviews.text: Thought It was a cool idea at first but kids got bored with it, sucks up the bug and everything else with it. Would not buy or recommend better off picking up with fingers
customer_reviews.author: LadyVee

customer_reviews.title: good for hairy spiders!
customer_reviews.text: Great for removing wolf spiders from your house. Works well for most bugs but not stink bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Reximus

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift. They loved it but said the suction wasn't the best.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Barely enough suction, but enough
customer_reviews.text: The suction is light but it's sufficient. It captures bugs like spiders, so I don't have to leave a bug gut smear on white walls. It safely captures and releases any bug that doesn't move fast, like spiders in my space. Can't attest to battery life yet. Only used a couple times so far.
customer_reviews.author: Harry P.

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: Suction is very weak. Very noisy. Scares away the bugs I’m trying to catch.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth B. Milhans

customer_reviews.title: Suction is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: This toys design is good but the suction is terrible. I understand that this is made for kids but when it doesn't even pick up a dead fly doesn't make it very exciting when I have to pick up bugs and put them in for the kids to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Pohlkotte

customer_reviews.title: Great for a week
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this- but it broke within a couple weeks. Thought the battery was dead, changed them and it still didn’t work. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Time Cop

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Worked about a week. Changed batteries, still wont work. Rip off!
customer_reviews.author: MaryP

customer_reviews.title: and was disappointed to realize it wasn't the batteries
customer_reviews.text: My son had this less than a year and it has already quit working. He took care of it. It was not left outside, or dropped, or treated in a way that might have contributed to a short toy life span. He changed the batteries today thinking the batteries were dead, and was disappointed to realize it wasn't the batteries, the toy just no longer works.
customer_reviews.author: cindyloo

customer_reviews.title: Bad investment.
customer_reviews.text: Two of the three I bought stopped working within 5 minutes. The light still worked, big deal. Now all 4 of the bug vacuums I bought have stopped working! What a waste of time having to order, reorder and return these items!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Suction stops working after first use even with battery replacement
customer_reviews.text: My son was so excited for this toy. The included batteries lasted half a day and when we replied the batteries the suction never worked again.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Set the bar low and you won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Same problem as other reviewers, my kids loved it and played with it for a while but it stopped working. The light comes on but the motor doesn't work. There doesn't appear to be any response from the manufacturer on a clearly faulty design. If anyone has recommendations for a better quality alternative, I'm all ears.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Suction
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this has almost no suction. It's practically impossible to get a bug sucked up. Even the smallest of ants won't go in! As my 6 year old said, "It's really cool but it doesn't suck!" Except that it kind of does suck.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, endless fun
customer_reviews.text: Great toy, my 5 year old loves this thing. The magnifying glass/trap door works great. Stock batteries aren't very powerful, replaced with some new good quality ones and now works great. I would give this 5 stars but I feel like the plastic tubing is relatively fragile and the threading feels like it could crack off pretty easily. For 5 stars, I would expect a much more durable toy for outdoors play.
customer_reviews.author: mwkrimson

customer_reviews.title: Well made but lacks suction.
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my son as a birthday gift, kid loves bugs. He’s drop it countless times and it’s sturdy. The issue is the suction power. Spiders hold on pretty tight and you basically have to scoop them up and then it will suck them. This gives for most insects.
customer_reviews.author: Nick B.

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 2 days
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but built very cheap. My son used it for a couple days before the plastic threads broke. Suction is a little weak as well. Wouldn't purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Giordano

customer_reviews.title: Super fun to take camping
customer_reviews.text: Super fun to take camping, picnics, and any outdoor playtime. My kids go on bug hunts now with their vacuums every time we are outside. It's easy to use and the batteries last a lot longer than I expected. This is a better quality than some of the other bug vacuums available.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: Needs a bit more suction. Other than that....BRILLIANT!! MY 6YO lived it!!
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: The thought was awesome, but it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: The thought was awesome. The sucking power is not really even existant. Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Samanthah

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Strong enough to suck up bees
customer_reviews.text: My nephew LOVES it! I purchased it as a gift for his birthday and he has spent the last four days sucking bugs up in the back yard. Works great. Strong enough to suck up bees, spiders and lightening bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Potter

customer_reviews.title: Broke after second pull
customer_reviews.text: I think my son pulled the trigger twice and the fan stopped working. It was like the trigger was stuck and couldn't be pulled in all the way. The light went on, but no fan. I took it apart and tried to fix it. I got it to work sometimes, but others, I have to pull the trigger because it's too hard for my kids to do.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gagne

customer_reviews.title: It was so much fun seeing how excited he got when he would catch ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as part of a bug chatching adventure gift for our sons 5th birthday. He had a BLAST with it for all of one day. Until is stopped working. It was so much fun seeing how excited he got when he would catch a spide or bug out in the garden. And it was a shame seeing him cry when his favorite birthday gift just stoppes working the next day. The laser on it still working however the vacuum is dead. Dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Great Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Now when my daughter sees a bug she runs and grabs it. She likes to examines them and then she releases them outside. It is fun for her!
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a day
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 of these (gave one to each of our families of grand kids). One broke within the first day. It just won’t run. The light lights up but it won’t work. We changed the batteries and still nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie Hart

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made motor! Stopped working immediately
customer_reviews.text: We just got this bug catcher and my son was so excited... he started using it right away... within the hour, the motor stopped working and hasn’t worked since! He is completely bummed
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: The perfect gift for any big loving child! My son LOVES this and it really works great!
customer_reviews.author: DIY123

customer_reviews.title: my kids love this thing, and we do too
customer_reviews.text: Our first gun did not work well but the seller kindly replaced it and we've had this one for over a year now. I use it to collect bugs (ants, spiders) when they're inside our house as a humane catch and release. My kids use it to examine bugs outside. Great kiddo present too.
customer_reviews.author: loloferrari

customer_reviews.title: Spider jail
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a joke for my daughter to use when she finds a spider in her room since she is terrified of them, now she can solve the problem herself and I do not have to be bothered
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It sucks,but not in a good way
customer_reviews.text: Paid too much, the reviews are correct, no sucking power
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Works great. 3 year old approved
customer_reviews.text: Actually works. My 3 year old nephew has caught many spiders and moths since Christmas. Also sucks up dog hair and cereal pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Mc Kenzie Houghton

customer_reviews.title: What a waste!
customer_reviews.text: On my list of biggest waste of money toys! It wouldn't suction up the most simple of bugs!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Motor quit working
customer_reviews.text: Lasted only 2 days before the motor quit working. Changed the batteries and it still wouldn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Pomlover

customer_reviews.title: Poor suction power!!
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson was very excited about this but it doesn't have enough suction to even get an ant! I would not recommend this product very disappointed! If I could give it minus on Section I would , one Star the lowest I could go
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: Works Well.
customer_reviews.text: I use this product to catch the spiders that come into my house and then release them outside. Thus far, no failed attempts. The trapping compartment is very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha-Prime

customer_reviews.title: Broken in 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Our children enjoyed this catcher, but unfortunately it broke a little too quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Kids love the idea of this and love to walk around ...
customer_reviews.text: Kids love the idea of this and love to walk around with it turned on BUT it is not strong enough to actually suck anything up, even with fresh batteries.
customer_reviews.author: xCHRIE

customer_reviews.title: Extremely weak suction
customer_reviews.text: Really, really weak. Laughably weak. I wasn't expecting Hoover quality suction or anything, but if you put your hand over the nozzle there is pretty much zero section. I'd imagine it would only pick up the tiniest, lightest of bugs. But the concept is so great. Our little bug lover was excited to receive it.
customer_reviews.author: VE

customer_reviews.title: I was so happy to find this replacement
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these and lost the plastic cover.... I was so happy to find this replacement. Works great. Vac and release. So much easier on the conscience :-) But I still squish the mosquitos.... And it's great fun for my granddaughter!
customer_reviews.author: Martha W Cohan

customer_reviews.title: This thing was almost awesome. It's a cool product I just wish the ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing was almost awesome. It's a cool product I just wish the vacuum had more "sucking" power than it does. This thing won't even pick up a lady bug.
customer_reviews.author: Markie Hale

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for my hubby. Now we all use it to get rid of the stinkbugs.
customer_reviews.author: victoria kern

product_meta.title: Nature Bound Bug Catcher Toy, Eco-Friendly Bug Vacuum, Catch and Release Indoor/Outdoor Play, Ages 5-12
product_meta.description: Color:GreenFor endless hours of fun, the environment-friendly bug vacuum toy lets kids find, catch, inspect, and release their favorite outdoor bugs. A built-in LED light, magnifier, and belt clip add to the adventure! Encourage kids to step away from their digital devices and investigate the great outdoors with an automatic bug catching gun. Fun, powerful features and exciting scientific design allows children age 5 to 12 to safely interact with nature, indoors or outdoors, at any time of the day or night. Patented catch-and-release technology keeps kids and bugs safe during exploration. A New Way to Play Challenge your kids to catch ants, beetles, flies, spiders, moths, and more! For homeschooling projects or weekend fun, promote inquisitive play and encourage budding scientists to document their catches and explore the world around them. The innovative bug catching gun allows for harmless catching, observing, and returning of all buggy specimens. Features include: *LED laser light *Carabineer belt clip *Built-in magnifier *Detachable core viewing capsule *Triggered suction mechanism *1-inch suction opening *AA Batteries (included) When you’re child is done inspecting their captured bugs, simply twist off and release your bug outdoors! They’ll love bug hunting in the backyard or helping to catch an indoor pest. For birthdays or holidays, this battery-operated gadget makes a great gift and encourages young learners to take interest in their natural surroundings. Give the gift of adventure with the Nature Bound bug catching gun.
feature_bullets: Bug catcher promotes scientific learning: an integrated LED light, carabineer, and battery operated vacuum mechanism make bug-catching fun! Kids age 5 to 12 can observe, keep notes, and make sketches.
Teach play: kids can inspect their favorite bugs without killing them! This patented, bug-safe vacuum sends each Bug gently into the core viewing Chamber for easy catch and release.
Use ANYWHERE, any time: The bug toy transitions seamlessly from Indoor to outdoors and day to night with integrated light and 1-inch suction head for all types of household and backyard bugs.
Safe, hygienic capture: with the chambered capture gun, your kids will not have to touch bugs while observing. Triggered suction and clear 360-degree sides keep your child engaged without a bugs.
30-Day money back : if you are not 100% satisfied with your bug vacuum toy, return it at any time within the first 30 days for your money back. Batteries included.

specifications.Included Components: Bug Vacuum, 4 x AA batteries, carabiner clip
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars654 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
